snippet: The rules fell short of many environmentalists’ demands to cut off such drilling entirely, but oil companies complained that they would stymie exploration....
abstract: Obama administration announces safety and environmental regulations to control offshore drilling in the Arctic Ocean off Alaskan coast; rules are criticized by both environmentalists, who argue they fall short of protections needed, and oil companies, who say they are too restrictive.
lead_paragraph: The rules fell short of many environmentalists’ demands to cut off such drilling entirely, but oil companies complained that they would stymie exploration.

headline.main: Latest of Obama’s Safety Rules on Arctic Drilling Are Released
headline.print_headline: U.S. Reveals Latest Safety Rules on Arctic Drilling

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Regulation and Enforcement
